text: Zvonimir Bilić (born 22 September 1971) is a former Croatian handball player and coach. He played for the national team of Croatia. ==Honours== ;Medveščak Zagreb *Limburgse Handbal Dagen (1): 1993 *Croatian First A League Runner-up (1): 1992-93 *Croatian Cup Finalist (3): 1992, 1993, 2006 ;Zagreb *Croatian First A League (7): 1993-94, 1994-95, 1995-96, 1996-97, 1997-98, 1998-99, 2004-2005 *Croatian Cup (7): 1994, 1995, 1996, 1997, 1998, 1999, 2005 *EHF Champions League Finalist (4): 1994-95, 1996-97, 1997-98, 1998-99 *EHF Cup Winners' Cup Finalist (1): 2005 ;Conversano *Serie A (1): 2002-03 *Coppa Italia (1): 2003 ;Individual *Greatest sportsperson of the city of Dugo Selo in the 20th Century - 2001 *9th top goalscorer for Croatia national team ===Orders=== *50pxOrder of Danica Hrvatska with face of Franjo Bučar - 1995 ==References== ==External links== *European competition Category:1971 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Livno Category:Croats of Bosnia and Herzegovina Category:Sportspeople from Zagreb Category:Croatian male handball players Category:Croatian handball coaches Category:RK Medveščak Zagreb players Category:RK Zagreb players Category:Mediterranean Games gold medalists for Croatia Category:Croatian expatriate sportspeople in Italy Category:Croatian expatriates in Germany Category:Croatian expatriates in Spain Category:Mediterranean Games medalists in handball Category:Competitors at the 2001 Mediterranean Games
title: Zvonimir Bilić
